title-group.article-title: Optimal Information for Approximating Periodic Analytic Functions

abstract.p: Let <latex>$S_\beta:= \{z \in \mathbb{C}:|\operatorname{Im} z| < \beta\}$</latex> be a strip in the complex plane. For fixed integer r ≥ 0 let H<sup>r</sup><sub>∞, β</sub> denote the class of 2π-periodic functions f, which are analytic in S<sub>β</sub> and satisfy |f<sup>(r)</sup> (z)| ≤ 1 in S<sub>β</sub>. Denote by H<sup>r, R</sup><sub>∞, β</sub> the subset of functions from H<sup>r</sup><sub>∞, β</sub> that are real-valued on the real axis. Given a function f ∈ H<sup>r</sup><sub>∞, β</sub>, we try to recover f(ζ) at a fixed point ζ ∈ R by an algorithm A on the basis of the information I f = (a<sub>0</sub>(f), a<sub>1</sub>(f), ..., a<sub>n - 1</sub>(f), b<sub>1</sub>(f), ..., b<sub>n - 1</sub>(f)), where a<sub>j</sub>(f), b<sub>j</sub>(f) are the Fourier coefficients of f. We find the intrinsic error of recovery <tex-math>$E(H^r_{\infty, \beta}, I):= \operatornamewithlimits{inf}_{A: \mathbb{C}^{2n - 1} \rightarrow \mathbb{C}} \operatornamewithlimits{sup}_{f \in H^r_{\infty, \beta}} |f(\zeta) - A(I f)|.$</tex-math> Furthermore the (2n - 1)-dimensional optimal information error, optimal sampling error and n-widths of H<sup>r, R</sup><sub>∞, β</sub> in C, the space of continuous functions on [ 0, 2π], are determined. The optimal sampling error turns out to be strictly greater than the optimal information error. Finally the same problems are investigated for the class H<sub>p, β</sub>, consisting of all 2π-periodic functions, which are analytic in S<sub>β</sub> with p-integrable boundary values. In the case p = 2 sampling fails to yield optimal information as well in odd as in even dimensions.
